item.title: Demux Analog Pot but Keep Value
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Hey Dave, what you are looking for is known as a hook, the one I use is TSG/ctrl/MultiPot 3, this means you can use one pot to control 3 separate controls or layers, then use a counter & toggle switch to select between the layers in hardware or a radio object in the patcher

http://www.privatepublic.de/public/community-objectlist.html#TSGctrl

Read full topic
item.source: Demux Analog Pot but Keep Value

item.title: Demux Analog Pot but Keep Value
item.dc:creator: @dontjudgedave David
item.description:
@dontjudgedave wrote:

So only one of my analog pots are working and I don't feel like opening up the case to resolder things, so I'm trying to use one analog pot for two different things. Right now I can do a gpio analog in through a demux and use a mini switch to swap the demux output.

The problem is, when I switch which line the pot is controlling the settings revert. Is there a way to have it hold the value when cutting off the constant feed?

for note, im running the pot into two sss/dist/boost that I kind of use for master volume for two different lines at the end of my chain (couldn't find a mix with inlets)

Read full topic
item.source: Demux Analog Pot but Keep Value
